meanings.definition: A type of small, sweet citrus fruit with a thin, easy-to-peel skin.
meanings.sent1: I love snacking on a juicy tangerine in the afternoon.
meanings.sent2: The grocery store had a sale on tangerines, so I bought a bag.
meanings.sent3: The playful squirrel stole a tangerine from the picnic basket.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as bright and refreshing as a tangerine on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: The tangerine's vibrant color and sweet taste made it a delightful treat.

meanings.definition: A bright orange color resembling that of a tangerine fruit.
meanings.sent1: She painted her room in a cheerful tangerine shade.
meanings.sent2: The sunset painted the sky in beautiful tangerine hues.
meanings.sent3: The artist mixed red and yellow to create a lovely tangerine color.
meanings.sent4: The tangerine glow of the streetlights gave the city a warm feel.
meanings.sent5: The tangerine dress she wore stood out among the crowd in its vividness.
